modCmd.description: Modify a command or argument descriptions, or add another argument for command. The cmdName.py file will not be modified.

arguments.argName: (argName...) Optional names of argument(s) to modify.

runTest.description: Run test(s) in ./tests directory. Use 'listTests' to see available tests.

arguments.testName: Optional name of specific test to run (without .py extension)
arguments.listTests: List all available tests in the tests directory

tmplMgt.description: cmdPackage template management for transferring new or modified  command files with supporting files back to an editable install of comPackage.th supporting file

option_switches.black: Use +black to enable and -black to disable, tracked python file formatting before template generation, and the new template after generation.
option_switches.force: Force template generation even if files are not modified.

arguments.status: Show status of all tracked files
arguments.scanFiles: Show detailed file discovery report including exclusions
arguments.listFiles: List files by category: tracked, untracked, noTracked, or new
arguments.sync: Synchronize all tracked files that have changes
arguments.trans: Transfer new templates back to cmdPackage
arguments.untrack: Remove a template from being tracked
arguments.notrack: Add files to doNotTrack list to exclude from tracking consideration

rmCmd.description: Remove <cmdName> and delete file cmdName.py, or remove an argument for a command.

arguments.cmdName: Name of command to remove, cmdName.py and other commands listed as argument(s) will be delated.
arguments.argName: Optional names of argument to remove.

fileDiff.description: Show the differences between two files.

newCmd.description: Add new command <cmdName> with [argNames...]. Also creates a file cmdName.py.

arguments.argName: (argName...) Optional names of argument to associate with the new command.

showCmd.description: Show meta data about a command.

arguments.classCall: The template used to first create the command.thed template used for this command.
